lead_paragraph: Russia’s foreign minister acknowledged that daily three-hour pauses in fighting in Aleppo were insufficient to halt a humanitarian disaster.

byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone reported from New York, and Alison Smale from Berlin. Andrew E. Kramer contributed reporting from Moscow.
byline.original: By RICK GLADSTONE and ALISON SMALE

headline.print_headline: Under Pressure Over Aleppo Siege, Russia Hints at Seeking Military Deal With U.S.
headline.main: Under Pressure Over Aleppo Siege, Russia Hints at Seeking Deal With U.S.

snippet: Russia’s foreign minister acknowledged that daily three-hour pauses in fighting in Aleppo were insufficient to halt a humanitarian disaster....
abstract: Russia concedes that daily three-hour halts in fighting in Syrian city of Aleppo are not enough to stop humanitarian disaster there, with some two million people trapped and unable to receive aid.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: International Committee of the Red Cross
